citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Female pug puppy (DOB 04-March-2023, Dam ID #9690) has poor eye health and nasal discharge. The surface of the
right eye is completely cloudy and has a blueish color. A small amount of dried yellow colored discharge is attached to
the hair around the eye. The left eye is sealed shut by dry yellow colored discharge and a wet grey discharge is around
both nostrils. The puppy has not been evaluated by a veterinarian and is not receiving any treatment. Poor eye health
could cause pain and discomfort to the dog and discharge from the eyes and nostrils could indicate an underlying illness.
Each dealer must use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The puppy
must be evaluated by a veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an effective treatment plan. The licensee
must ensure that each animal receives adequate veterinary care at all times.
To be corrected by: The licensee was verbally instructed at the time of the inspection to have the puppy evaluated by the
end of business 27-April-2023.

Eight dogs and their acquisition information are missing from APHIS form 7005 (Record of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats
on Hand). The acquisition information is necessary for APHIS officials to identify dogs and to trace their movements.
Each dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the required information for each
dog purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, in possession of, or which is transported, euthanized, sold or
otherwise disposed of. The licensee must add the eight dogs and their acquisition information to APHIS form 7005. The
licensee must ensure that all required documents are complete with all necessary information.
To be corrected by: APHIS form 7005 must be kept current beginning on 24-April-2023.

A 3-month-old dachshund puppy is housed with two adult pugs. Neither of the pugs are the puppy's dam or foster dam.
Housing puppies with adults that are not their dam could cause injury to the puppy should the adult become aggressive or
interfere with the puppy's access to food should the adult display resource guarding behaviors.
Puppies 4 months of age or less may not be housed in the same primary enclosure with adult dogs other than their dams
or foster dams. The licensee must either house the puppy alone or with pen mates that meet the requirements for
compatible housing. The licensee must ensure that all dogs housed in the same enclosure are compatible at all times.
To be corrected by: The puppy was moved to a new enclosure at the time of the inspection.

On 04-April-2023, female pug (microchip #000005830709) was examined by the attending veterinarian for a concern with
the left eye. No medical record exists documenting this examination along with the results and treatment plan.
The facility had six dogs tested for heartworm and fecals done for eight dogs. No medical record exists that contains the
identification of which dogs were tested or the results of these tests.
Failure to create a complete medical record may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals are
receiving adequate veterinary care.
Each dealer shall keep copies of medical records that include the identification of the animal, dates and results of all
screening, routine, or other required or recommended tests or examinations. The licensee must document on a medical
record the identification of the animal, the results of all examinations and tests performed, and any treatment plans. The
licensee must ensure that all medical records are complete and contain all required information.
To be corrected by: The licensee was verbally instructed at the time of the inspection to have a documented medical
record for the condition of the eye of female pug (#000005830709) by end of business 27-April-2023. The facility must
begin keeping all other medical records starting on 24-April-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Female pug puppy (DOB 04-March-2023, Dam ID #9690) has poor eye health and nasal discharge.  The surface of the 
right eye is completely cloudy and has a blueish color.  A small amount of dried yellow colored discharge is attached to 
the hair around the eye.  The left eye is sealed shut by dry yellow colored discharge and a wet grey discharge is around 
both nostrils.  The puppy has not been evaluated by a veterinarian and is not receiving any treatment.  Poor eye health 
could cause pain and discomfort to the dog and discharge from the eyes and nostrils could indicate an underlying illness. 
 
Each dealer must use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries.  The puppy 
must be evaluated by a veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an effective treatment plan.  The licensee 
must ensure that each animal receives adequate veterinary care at all times. 
 
To be corrected by:  The licensee was verbally instructed at the time of the inspection to have the puppy evaluated by the 
end of business 27-April-2023. 
2.75(a) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors

Eight dogs and their acquisition information are missing from APHIS form 7005 (Record of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats 
on Hand).  The acquisition information is necessary for APHIS officials to identify dogs and to trace their movements. 
 
Each dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the required information for each 
dog purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, in possession of, or which is transported, euthanized, sold or 
otherwise disposed of.  The licensee must add the eight dogs and their acquisition information to APHIS form 7005.  The 
licensee must ensure that all required documents are complete with all necessary information. 
 
To be corrected by:  APHIS form 7005 must be kept current beginning on 24-April-2023. 
3.7(c) 
   
Compatible grouping. 
A 3-month-old dachshund puppy is housed with two adult pugs.  Neither of the pugs are the puppy's dam or foster dam.  
Housing puppies with adults that are not their dam could cause injury to the puppy should the adult become aggressive or 
interfere with the puppy's access to food should the adult display resource guarding behaviors.     
 
Puppies 4 months of age or less may not be housed in the same primary enclosure with adult dogs other than their dams 
or foster dams.  The licensee must either house the puppy alone or with pen mates that meet the requirements for 
compatible housing.  The licensee must ensure that all dogs housed in the same enclosure are compatible at all times. 
 
To be corrected by:  The puppy was moved to a new enclosure at the time of the inspection. 
3.13(b) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs.

On 04-April-2023, female pug (microchip #000005830709) was examined by the attending veterinarian for a concern with 
the left eye.  No medical record exists documenting this examination along with the results and treatment plan.   
 
The facility had six dogs tested for heartworm and fecals done for eight dogs.  No medical record exists that contains the 
identification of which dogs were tested or the results of these tests. 
 
Failure to create a complete medical record may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals are 
receiving adequate veterinary care. 
 
Each dealer shall keep copies of medical records that include the identification of the animal, dates and results of all 
screening, routine, or other required or recommended tests or examinations.  The licensee must document on a medical 
record the identification of the animal, the results of all examinations and tests performed, and any treatment plans.  The 
licensee must ensure that all medical records are complete and contain all required information.   
 
To be corrected by:  The licensee was verbally instructed at the time of the inspection to have a documented medical 
record for the condition of the eye of female pug (#000005830709) by end of business 27-April-2023.  The facility must 
begin keeping all other medical records starting on 24-April-2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
